reviewText: Actually, the DVD cover and title are a bit deceptive. While a full "SQUAD" may appear in some future sequel, there is only one SAMURAI woman in this film. During an initiation ritual, Miss Lili (Ruru Anoa) goes back in time after drinking some tea. She wakes up 300 years in the past, and must defend a small village against an eeevil band of ninjas. Of course, as the title OPPAI CHANBARA: STRIPTEASE SAMURAI SQUAD implies, there is a good deal of toplessness going on, and a couple of soft-core, simulation sequences as well. Other than that, it's a pretty straightforward martial arts / swordplay movie. I found it entertaining and quite humorous in spots. Worth a watch for the not-easily-offended...

reviewText: This is a soft core silly samurai film on a meager budget without any striptease squad and without any serious action coreography.  Sort of a samuari science fiction twist with cheap special effects. This film is eye candy for men who can appreciate the beauty of a woman with a sword.

reviewText: Don't get me wrong, I have seen some really bad "B" movies, but I have actually seen some good ones to. Some "B" movies tell a good story, some are just pointless stories that have no originality.Overall this is not that bad a movie, but I wouldn't expect this to make it to the Oscars (Or whatever the award is called in Asia) The overall experience with the movie is not to bad. It's obvious the fight scenes were coordinated as well as the actors not being too experienced with fighting with swords. The main idea of this movie is to see topless ladies. According to the movie, there's suppose to be a reason why they strip topless, and I will give you a hint, it's not to impress the guys. (Don't ask me to explain it, just watch the movie and figure it out yourself. I would tell you more, but I am not the kind to spoil a movie much, you will just have to buy it and see for yourself) The quality of the movie is not too bad, I have seen a lot worse, so they definitely spent money on this production. The lines and acting are very "B" movie like. Cute one liners, cartoonish humor, and the facial expressions are too easy to read. Storyline is pretty easy to follow. Overall not a bad movie, but obviously, the enjoyment is the nudity.(This part of the information is for reference purposes only) For the record, the DVD box says it's a "spoof" of the original XBOX video game "Onechanbara"... Personally, I doubt that, as I have the game, although I can see how there's a connection to it. "Onechanbara" is of a female Samurai, who wears a cowboy hat, feather boa, and bikini, who kills zombies. (An Asian variation of Resident Evil series if you will) This movie, there's no zombies, at least none that I could see that could be explained or defined as a zombie. Although the company who made this movie (Jolly Roger) did also make a "Onechanbara" movie based on the game.Got this item in about 3 days using standard USPS.
summary: Another nice "B" movie to watch when you are so bored of "A" movies...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Okay, let's clear up a thing or two.  First, there is no squad.  Its one chick (Miss Lili, the center lady on the cover) vs another chick (the left lady on the cover).  No samurai squad.  Secondly, only two chicks strip.  Granted, they strip A LOT but still, only two.  Also, it's virtually all T with very little A.Now that that's out of the way, was the movie decent?  Well, that depends.  If you're expecting a movie that could have had Jackie Chan in it but he had other obligations so they cast Yichi Matsuda instead, then you're going to be SORELY disappointed.  This movie is low budget, low special effects, low acting, and low faking martial arts.  But it's got boobs.  Two pairs of 'em that show up repeatedly throughout the film.  Now, that may not be enough to entice you to watch this movie.  I mean, this is the friggin' internet.  You can see boobs anytime.  Hold up, grasshopper.  There is something magical that Striptease Samurai Squad has that no other movie does...Breast magic...Breast-induced eclipses...Breast martial arts (breast sword blocking, breast sword disarms)...Breast-powered time travel...No, I'm not kidding (well, maybe a little on that last one, but still...).  This movie should be shown on all the major networks each night during Breast Cancer Awareness month (that's like, October).  See, World?  Breasts are powerful tools to be revered, and feared!  With but a 2-hour acting seminar, a prop sword and no inhibitions ANY woman can be a Striptease Samurai!  Righting wrongs and vanquishing evildoers with the jiggly power of fem-justice!!!  By the Power of Breastfull...!!!So, yeah, if you like boobs and are forgiving of low budget movies this is definitely worth the watch.  I give it 3-1/2 brea-, er, stars rounded up to 4.  There really should have been a squad...
